formatName: VICAR (Video Image Communication and Retrieval) Planetary File Format
formatDescription:
The VICAR  image file format is used primarily for storing planetary image data collected by both interplanetary spacecraft and Earth-based stations. Many astronomical and astrophysical organizations use and support the VICAR format. 
Full specifications available at http://www-mipl.jpl.nasa.gov/external/VICAR_file_fmt.pdf
provenanceCompoundName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

internalSignatures.name: VICAR Planetary File Format
internalSignatures.note:
Header ASCII: 'LBLSIZE=n, followed by FORMAT='(BYTE|HALF|FULL|REAL|DOUB|COMP|COMPLEX|WORD|LONG)'
The label is always located at the beginning of the file.
